events.name: Meteor April (in May) Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, We are group of people who think MeteorJS is awesome. We are planning our April (in May) meetup of the Meteor JS group. Call for speakers! Message us or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm. ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - Deploying Meteor Apps to Production Environments - Tze Ken Lee #2 - Adding a RESTful interface to your Meteor App - Rick Behl - If you wish to follow along the tutorial please install Meteor, MongoDB and Postman ( https://www.getpostman.com/ ) beforehand #3 - TBC #4 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg/ Slack: https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: http://singapore.meteor.com/ #5 Socializing / Networking ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Pizza and drinks will be provided courtesy of AWS. Location: AWS Offices Singapore 23 Church Street, Capital Square #10-01, 049481 Singapore Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Organizers : Tze Ken Lee , Cofounder & Director at InnoMonster Pte. Ltd. 5 years of experience in web development. Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur
events.location: Amazon Web Services Office, Level 10, 23 Church Street, Singapore

events.name: Yet Another Two Haskell Talks in May (by Arnauld and Gergo)
events.description: A big thanks to Michał's support so that we could use HackerSpace.SG as a steady base for the meetup. Starting from May, we would try to change to a monthly schedule, We try to arrange the meetup to be at the first Wednesday of each month, since we observe that more RSVP on meetup hosted on Wednesday. Therefore we always welcome speakers willing to share things related to Haskell, no matter it is basic or advanced or lightning talk. Don't hesitate to contact us. For the meetup in May, we would have three haskell talks. First one is Arnaud Bailly share on building startup in haskell. Second one is FPGA synthesis by Dr. Gergő Érdi. We are going to finish with a lightning talk on an alternative description of Haskell packages by Simon Hengel. * Haskell all the way down - building a startup in Haskell Sneak peak of past slide: https://speakerdeck.com/abailly/haskell-all-the-way-down * FPGA synthesis with Kansas Lava * hpack: An alternative format for Haskell packages (lightning talk) # Speakers: Arnaud Bailly: https://github.com/abailly Dr. Gergő Érdi: http://unsafePerform.IO Simon Hengel: http://typeful.net
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore
